attributes.action: Cease to use the word 'honourable' when referring to members of the House of Commons until such time as trust by the public in their integrity is restored
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The problem with an honour hased expenses system is that it ceases to operate effectively when those who use it behave without honour, resulting is systematic abuse.

The large number of MPs who have abused the publics trust in them via unjustifiable and unreasonable expenses claims means it is no longer appropriate to commonly refer to members as 'honourable', this part of their title should be removed from common use until such time as the house is able to restore public confidence in it's memebrs integrity and prove itself worthy of it's restoration.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for Parliament: 
http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
